intro: Aellenia postii, commonly known as the Cape orchid, is a small, flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in coastal areas. Its flowers are usually pale pink or white, with a distinctive lip that aids in pollination. Aellenia postii is relatively rare and is often found in specific microhabitats along the south-western coast of South Africa.
